== Kubuntu 10.10 to 11.04 Upgrade ==

=== Upgrade to Kubuntu 11.04 ===

1) Click on the upgrade notification "Start upgrade now"

<nowiki>[[File:natty-upgrade-1.png]]</nowiki>

Or open Software Management in System Settings and go to Software Upgrades

<nowiki>[[File:natty-upgrade-2.png]]</nowiki> <nowiki>[[File:natty-upgrade-3.png]]</nowiki> <nowiki>[[File:natty-upgrade-4.png]]</nowiki>

----

Upgrade to 11.04 with an '''alternate''' CD:

This is only if you do not have an internet connection to upgrade with.

1) Insert the alternate CD, open it in a new window, open the '''Run Command''' dialog by pressing '''Alt+F2'''.  Type <code>kdesudo "/media/cdrom/cdromupgrade"</code> in the command box and press the '''return''' button. <<BR>>
<nowiki>[[File:karmic-lucid-upgrade-cdrom.png]]</nowiki> <<BR>>

----

2) Enter your password<<BR>>
<nowiki>[[File:natty-upgrade-5.png]]</nowiki>

----

3) Review the release notes <<BR>>
<nowiki>[[File:natty-upgrade-6.png]]</nowiki>

----
3) The upgrade tool will start <<BR>>
<nowiki>[[File:11.04-natty-upgrade3.png]]</nowiki>

----

4) It will confirm if you want to start the upgrade<<BR>>
<nowiki>[[File:natty-upgrade-8.png]]</nowiki>

----

5) It will download and install the new release, have some coffee<<BR>>
<nowiki>[[File:11.04-natty-upgrade5.png]]</nowiki>

----

6) It may ask about conf file changes, click '''Replace''' to upgrade<<BR>>
<nowiki>[[File:natty-upgrade-9.png]]</nowiki>

----

7) It will ask to confirm removing obsolete packages, click '''Remove'''. <<BR>>
<nowiki>[[File:natty-upgrade-10.png]]</nowiki>

----

8) The last step of the entire process is to go ahead and reboot your machine. <<BR>>
<nowiki>[[File:natty-upgrade-11.png]]</nowiki>

== Welcome to Kubuntu 11.04 ==
If everything went smoothly after the upgrade and the reboot, your desktop should look like the following: <<BR>>
<nowiki>[[attachment:natty-upgrade-done.png|<nowiki>[[File:natty-upgrade-done-wee.png]]</nowiki></nowiki>]]
